title: MF Doom: Hip-hop star dies aged 49
description: One of hip-hop's most influential MCs, masked rapper MF Doom died in October, his family confirm.

title: Online drone display lights up skies for Hogmanay
description: Fare Well, a three-part series, sees drones forming images across the skies of Scotland.

title: Obituary: Tommy Docherty - man of many clubs and quips
description: Former Chelsea, Man Utd and Scotland manager Tommy Docherty, who has died aged 92, will be remembered for one of the most colourful careers.

title: In pictures: Winter scenes from around UK
description: As 2020 draws to a close temperatures in the UK drop and parts of the country are bathed in snow and frost.

title: Covid: How does mass testing work?
description: Mass testing is being used to find out if people have Covid-19 - whether or not they have symptoms.

title: Australia-China row: 'I'm Australian - why do I need to prove my loyalty?'
description: Many Chinese-Australians fear a "new McCarthyism" as Australia's values are tested by its China row.

title: Andy Murray pulls out of ATP event in Delray Beach
description: Britain's former world number one Andy Murray pulls out of next week's ATP event in Delray Beach - but not because of injury concerns.

title: Covid: Pandemic dampens New Year celebrations around the world
description: As the virus continues to spread in many countries, governments are set to crack down on revellers.

title: Covid-19: Stay home for new year, public told
description: People are urged not to gather as more areas of England are placed in the toughest tier of restrictions.

title: Covid-19: School closures will be 'as short as possible'
description: Pledge over mass testing in schools as warning given not to mix for New Year's Eve celebrations.

title: Covid-19: Doctors call for rapid rollout of vaccines
description: But there are fears bottlenecks in the system may hamper how fast NHS can deliver jabs.

title: Mark Wood column: Christmas, South Africa, Sri Lanka and 2021
description: England fast bowler Mark Wood gives an insight into his Christmas, reflects on the abandoned tour of South Africa and looks ahead to 2021.

title: Spent less, saved more: How we used our money this year
description: Consumer spending fell 7.1%, says Barclaycard, which tracks half of all credit and debit card spending.

title: Closed mountain road turns into ski run
description: A group of local ski students have been taking advantage of the winter snow on a closed mountain road.

title: How 2021 was celebrated around the world
description: Fireworks went off around the globe but crowds were only allowed at some displays.

title: Jane Garvey hosts final Woman's Hour: 'The programme needs to move on'
description: The programme's co-host for 13 years says it "needs to move on, and now it can".

title: Brexit: UK braced for changes as it cuts ties to EU
description: New rules on trade, travel, living abroad and duty-free shopping will kick in from 11pm.

title: Ticketmaster fined $10m for business 'intrusions'
description: The US Department of Justice says the firm unlawfully tried to "choke off" a competitor's business.

title: Grace Victory: YouTuber with Covid 'responding well to treatment'
description: Grace Victory is in an induced coma after giving birth to her first child on Christmas Eve.

title: Offloading players is Arsenal priority - Arteta
description: Arsenal will prioritise offloading players in the January transfer window, says manager Mikel Arteta.

title: Motherwell: Stephen Robinson resigns as manager - 'I've taken it as far as I can'
description: Stephen Robinson resigns as manager of Motherwell after Wednesday's defeat by Kilmarnock left his side without a win in nine matches.

title: New Year Honours: Lewis Hamilton knighted as Rob Burrow becomes MBE
description: Formula 1 world champion Lewis Hamilton is knighted in the New Year Honours, with Rob Burrow, Anne Keothavong and Jimmy Greaves becoming MBEs.

title: Covid rule-breakers 'have blood on their hands'
description: An intensive care doctor tells BBC Radio 5 Live the rise in cases is down to people not social distancing.

title: New Year's Eve: 'Why we're happy it's cancelled'
description: Covid restrictions mean ringing in the new year will be a quieter affair for most.

title: Trump's call for $2,000 cheques blocked by Senate leader
description: Mitch McConnell says raising aid cheques from $600 would be "another fire hose of borrowed money".

title: Hammon becomes first woman to lead NBA team after Spurs' head coach ejected
description: Becky Hammon becomes the first woman to lead an NBA team after San Antonio Spurs head coach Gregg Popovich is ejected against the Los Angeles Lakers.

title: Pogba to Juve? Alli to PSG? The players who could be on the move in January
description: No winter break and a shorter season means clubs may dip into the transfer market, BBC Sport takes a look at players who could move in January.

title: The Papers: 'Jabs for freedom by Easter' and 'schools chaos'
description: The papers say the approval of a new vaccine could see the UK open up as soon as April.

title: Brexit: Couples therapists' guide to the break-up
description: Whether it's loss or joy or family rows, we asked couples therapists for their advice on Brexit.

title: Remembering the entertainment and arts figures we lost in 2020
description: Remembering some of the figures from music, film, TV, radio and literature who died in 2020.

title: Coronavirus doctor's diary: ‘Close to death from Covid, I asked them to save my baby’
description: A 22-year-old became seriously ill with Covid while pregnant, but ultimately both mother and baby were saved.

title: 2020 in pictures: Coronavirus in the UK
description: Images that defined the year a pandemic dominated the nation.

title: St Pauls riots: 'People were shouting revolution' in Bristol
description: The unrest in the St Pauls area of Bristol in 1980 was a defining moment for many black people in the city.

title: Four protests that triggered change - and one that didn't
description: The BBC looks at a selection of history's powerful protests and why only some achieved their goals.

title: London's 'Lido ladies' inspiring others to dive in for mental health
description: Nicola and Jessica are encouraging women to get back in the pool to enjoy the freedom of swimming.

title: Lookahead 2021: What's happening in the world of science?
description: The BBC's global science correspondent Rebecca Morelle looks at what's coming up in the next year.
